page.title: 03HOUSING AND POPULATION
page.content: The oldest areas of housing in{Belper {and Milford}are the cottages on both sides of the{Derwent}which housed the {Strutt employees. These homes, now in an area of conservation, were built between{1785 and{1790.}The Park's Council estate built in{1956}offered homes to many miners and foundary workers. The largest residential areas of Belper, built between {1962 and 1985, extend eastwards from the Derwent. Many of Derby's{British Rail and Rolls {Royce}staff live in these homes alongside those who work locally. The {population today is 18,000. Farmers and professional people live in{Hazelwood Village.}There homes are built of stone and are luxurious and expensive.
